eu_initiatives: Human Rights - gender equality -social justice -ethical issues- woman rights - racism - stem cell research - scientific research - education - youth - employment - Freedom issues (religious freedom, freedom of press, freedom of opinion and expression, freedom of sexual and reproductive rights,...) - external action services - humanitarian rights - policy making - influence of church on EU decision making - religious radicalism and extremism - liberal and social democracy - EU core values - inter-generational dialogue - interfaith dialogue - privacy - internet freedom - lobbying in general - diplomacy - food and agriculture (ritual slaughtering) - Regionalism (CoR) and territoriality - migration - Status of the non-confessional organizations - relationship religion/states.

relevant_communication:
All implementations, relations and communications linked to any topic mentioned here above.  
Specific negotiations with Parliament and Commission in regard with the status of non-confessional organisations and non-believers in Europe.
goals__remit:
Our goal is to develop the non-confessional Humanist Community by: 
-taking actions, to support and coordinate actions requested by our member organisations  
-taking initiatives and developing actions in cooperation with our member organisations 
-organising, managing and building moral assistance for the general population, as for specific categories 
-representing the non-confessional Humanist community at the governmental and third party level 
 
The goal of the organisation is also to monitor, advocate and defend the rights of humanists, atheists, non-believers, agnosts, rationalists, scepticists and free thinkers locally, nationally, in Europe and the world by defending their interests, advocate in international institutions and promote their values of Human Rights, equality and freedom wherever a lack of these values can be observed.
